mdRecord.dcterms:title: Carrel 4-5, north wall
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Donohue, Liam Patrick [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Phone number with offer of money for best gorilla imitation. Lyrics from song "The Spirit of Radio," by Rush, but adapted for the library (original lyrics: 'For the words of the profits were written on the studio wall, Concert hall, And echoes with the sound of salesmen...of salesmen...of salesmen.'); the first portion appears to have been written by one person, with subsequent lines added on by others in response. Praise for folk music duo Simon and Garfunkel. Doodle of face. [work]
Student graffiti art and messages inscribed on carrel walls in the new stacks, Alderman Library, University of Virginia, prior to the renovation of the building, 2020-2023. [host]

[telephone number] | VOICEMAIL OF BEST GORILLA IMPRESSION WINS $20 | My last exam as an undergrad! | Simon and Garfunkel Forever | The words of the prophet are written on the --subway-- library walls ‚ÜêNICE! | LOVE! | and echo with the sound of salesmen | OF SALESMEN!!! | OfSalesmen! | of salesmen!
